result.execSummary:
The defendant Bishop O Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property >$5000 - $10,000 or Firearm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bm).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence credit is to be determined. Defense attorney to file a letter with the court.
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: Count 2 and any other sentence he may be serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution for Paul and Priscilla R listed. To be paid as a condition of extended supervision and before all other costs/fines/surcharges.
DNA surcharge to be paid as a condition of extended supervision. Felony court costs waived.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  
No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. 
Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. 
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

No contact with:  victims (or their residences) listed in the Criminal Complaint;
Mental Heath evaluation or psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.
Earn an HSED or GED.
Court recommends defendant be evaluated for Trauma Care and any follow through deemed appropriate.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: To be completed as a condition of extended supervision, as directed by agent.

Credit to be determined. Defense attorney to file a letter with the court.

08:42 AM Defendant Bishop O Davis in court by Zoom with attorney Maura McMahon.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. McMahon and defendant made statements to the Court.  The Court made statements regarding the Motion.  For reasons as stated on the record, the Motion is denied.

for Sentence Credit and to Amend Judgment of Conviction with attached document filed by defendant.

Therefore, the Court cannot properly address the request for custody credit. Columbia Correctional Institution called at 9:30 a.m. and left a voicemail indicating there were techinical difficulties on there end and were prepared to have the video conference proceed.  
The court was not aware of the call at that time but did call to set up the new video conference date of June 27, 2019 at 1:30 p.m.

09:10 AM Attorney Sam Benedict in court.   Defendant Bishop O Davis did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   The defendant did not appear as the court did confirm a video appearance, he was not made available by the facility.  
Attorney Benedict reports to the court that Attorney McMahon will be appointed to this case.  They are waiting for the file from trial counsel.  
Defendant to appear by video at the next court date.  Hearing scheduled for June 27, 2019 at 01:30 pm.

Order granting in part and denying in part defendant's 809.30 postconviction motion. Signed by Judge Ralph M. Ramirez on 4/24/19

Denied by Judge Ramirez 4/24/19 - The public right to access the documents outweighs any concerns that the judge will be innapropriately "tainted" by the information contained in the documents or transcripts.

Hearing on May 6, 2019 at 01:30 pm.

01:25 PM Defendant Bishop O Davis in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica. Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court continues motion from 11/8/18. Defendant takes the stand. Sworn in and testifies. Cross examination by the State. Redirect by Atty. Masnica. Redirect by the State. Testimony is closed. Atty. Masnica gives closing arguments. State gives closing arguments. Atty. Masnica responds to the State's closing arguments. For reasons set out on the record, the Court will find that Atty. Kay was ineffective and as a result the defendant was not able to enter a knowing plea. The Court will allow the withdrawal of the plea. Court orders a $1000.00 signature bond. Case to be transferred to Judge Dorow. Defendant to appear by video at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 6, 2019 at 01:30 pm.  Check Case scheduled for April 22, 2019.

Defendant Bishop O Davis in court, in custody, by video,  with attorney Timothy T. Kay.   Pablo Gala\viz  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The Court calls the case to address restitution being requested by the victim P.R.  P.R.  is sworn in and the State conducts direct examination of the witness.  The victim is requesting $4,226.16 in restitution.    Exhibits #1 and #2 are marked by the State.    Attorney Kay conducts cross examination of the witness.   The witness is excused.   The Defense calls the Defendant to testify.  The Defendant is sworn in.  Attorney Kay conducts direct examination of the witness.   The Defendant is excused.   The State presents closing statement.  Attorney Kay presents closing statement. The Court orders restitution be set in the amount of $5,526.16 to victim listed in criminal complaint.
